I just ordered my third bottle a couple of days ago and I went back to look at the ingredients because there was something in particular I wanted to check for. I don’t even remember what it was because to my dismay I saw high up on the list “dimethicone” which is the one ingredient that is always a deal breaker for me. I refuse to use any skincare products that contain silicones. Why? Silicones, to put it plainly, are essentially plastic. But even though some may argue (respectively) that silicones are okay because they prevent TEWL, I realized in more ways than one that it didn’t do much for my skin. 1) it would create a blurring effect for my forehead fine lines but as soon as I cleansed my skin the next day and patted dry, they would be right back to how they were before (and mind you, I’d been using it for a while now so this isn’t a one or two time try and review), and 2) I couldn’t figure out how my skin was suddenly so prone to clogged pores but now it all makes sense - the silicones sitting on top of my skin. This retinol did WONDERS for my skin. TIP: BEFORE YOU START A RETINOL, DO YOUR RESEARCH!!! Retinol is an amazing ingredient, but you need to know how it works and the beginning stages of it. not greasy. you can feel it working. use this every night to get results.

I love everything inkey list but this ones a personal favorite. I disagree about any harsh smell and really you don’t want your face products to have fragrance anyways. Needed a retinol I could use every day and be affordable. This is it! I’ve already purchased another one!
Never tried retinol product, and was pleased with this one. Small, reasonable price and absolutely effective.

review_title: An excellent non-irritating retinol, amazing price

I bought this product on amazon and I started using it once or twice a week... Unfortunately this product made me breakout with acne. It’s not for all skin types.

This stuff is the bomb!! Sure it smells a bit earthy but I can live with that for retinol that’s actually retinol and works like it for what $9.99?!?! Amazing price amazing results. Guys I’m in love with this baby

Maybe it has something to do with my oily skin? It only made me break out there, and the rest of my face was fine. I’ve been using for a couple of weeks now and have noticed a vast difference in my skin. I do have aging skin, I’m 45 and it doesn’t irritate and it’s a clean product. Love this retinol. Non irritating and easy to apply. Pairs nicely with the Inkey List Niacinamide.

I’ve recently noticed a lot of breakouts and texture on my forehead and thought I’d give this a try. After a week of using I’ve already noticed a difference in smoothness and less breakouts. Not to mention it’s super cheap, which is a plus! Very impressed, would definitely recommend.
This did nothing for my skin. I have acne prone skin and I wanted to add this to my regimine. I saw no difference in my skin.

So, I am definitely not new to retinol, as I have been getting prescription retinol for years. I have a very sensitive, combination skin type that is acne prone. I’ve been in the dermatigists office since I was 9. To give you an idea of my skincare routine the past 10 years, I use a benzoyl peroxide wash at least 3 times a week, about the same amount of lactic acid per week (sometimes I’ll use clarisonic instead), retinol, and topical clindamycin. Obviously, these products are all VERY drying without a good moisturizer. I really like this product though because I tend to peel a lot (ew!) from the prescription retinol recently (guess my skin type changed a little with age now that I’m 23) but this stuff is definitely more gentle than any one I’ve ever used.I have tried both drug store retinols and high end retinols. I wanted to try something different because I still hadnt found one that was both affordable and gave solid results without crazy irritation. I didnt see the point in paying $80 for a retinol when it usually causes me to peel. (I know peeling is normal with retinol, but not if it doesnt improve. mine wouldnt with, i think, 1% products). I saw how quickly this has been selling out and have been in love with simple skin care lately, and I am very impressed already! This stuff is perfect for my skin so far because it easily absorbs and doesnt irritate my sensitive skin! it’s a little sticky at first, but it quickly disappears, especially after moisturizing. You definitely want to put this under your moisturizer tho as if you layer it on top it likely wouldn’t sink into your skin as well with a thicker product underneath. I still think a good moisturizer is important when using any retinol though, especially if you’re new to it, which is why I suggest using this as a serum prior to moisturizing. Prolonged use can cause irritation and break outs if you’re not supplementing with enough moisture to compensate for the retinol!

I do think this product has helped improved my skin, but I’m definitely looking to try something else. I’ve lost a lot of it because it just pours out of its container, it doesn’t have a pleasant smell (smells chemically) and it feels sticky. I will say though, it was the first retinol so maybe this is how they all are. If so it’s decent for the price.

I have sensitive oily skin that breaks out easily and reacts to absolutely everything. I’ve been recently dealing with adult acne that has never happened before and nothing seemed to fix it. I had been wanting to try a retinol cream to help with that but was hesitant that things would make it worse. After reading reviews I decided to try this and within 3 days my skin had cleared up. It’s noticeably clearer and my lines on my forehead have been reduced. I’m excited to continue seeing results. I had absolutely no bad reaction to it and my skin loves it. Will continue using this. Other people even noticed the improvements in my skin. If you’re on the fence TRY THIS!

If you have used other serums before, this one is different as it has a yellow tint and is less translucent. I do notice my skin gets a bit drier using this at night (as it should with retinol), so please moisturize well or use it after your moisturizer if your skin gets irritated. I don’t see a huge difference in my fine lines but my skin feels smoother - all in all worth trying, esp for $10.I saw some reviews saying it’s tiny - FYI, 1 oz / 30 ml is standard for serums. Only cult favorite ones produce bigger in volumes
Love this formula! You need to use for a couple of days/weeks to see results but it is gentle on the skin. I alternate between this and The Ordinary 2% AHA at night.

Great retinol for the price point. I have used retinol for quite awhile, and while my favorite is Paula’s Choice 1% Clinical retinol (delivers better results). I like this product. Retinol isn’t a product you get quick results with. But I can say I notice a difference of  my fine wrinkles becoming less noticeable. It goes on well and only takes a small amount  it’s a gel like texture. I will continue to use this retinol
works better than any other retinol I’ve tried (and I’ve tried them all)

I’ll probably opt for a more potent formula once I finish this product but I think it’s a great starter retinol.

This is a review for Sephora more than the product. This product was shipped to be and left at the end of my driveway instead of my doorstep. My driveway is super long, and it was very hot, so the product got some heat damage. Please talk to your shipping and delivering departments!
Just do it. For this price and the quality of the product you can’t go wrong. It is a staple in my skincare routine.  Well tolerated for someone with redness and sensitivity.

This works so well, my skin has been smoother and more even in the past three weeks of use. I went to buy more of this and it’s out-of-stock! Highly recommended.

Wow! I’ve used a couple other retinol products and this is my favorite so far...and it’s the cheapest one I’ve tried. My face has never felt so smooth in my life. I get a little peeling, but that’s inevitable with retinol products.

I would give no stars if I could. Really disappointed since their brand is all about getting straight to the point on their ingredients! Ok first off this product doesn’t even have that much of a % of retinol in it, “RetiStar” is actually a compound of vitamin e, castor oil, sodium acsorbate and a tinyyyyyy bit of retinol! so your just getting .05% of the retinol itself. Wack, I had really clear skin before using it and literally the morning after I used it, I woke up with fungal acne everywhere!!!! I kept using it about 3-4 times or so before realizing THIS product was causing it. Absolutely terrible, first & last product I’ll buy from Inkey. Anyways stan the ordinary since they’re honest & not scamming!

I have sensitive skin, and I use this like 3-4 times a week. I like it. It doesn’t irritate my skin, and goes on smooth. A little goes a long way, so it can last for awhile. You also can’t beat this price!

This is a great reunion product for the price. I personally did not have any negative reaction to it, feels gentle on my skin. If you are looking to try retinol but don’t want to pay big bucks to start, this is definitely a great option!

I’ve had deep forehead expression lines since high school and wasn’t expecting this to have any effect on them. Super surprised to see how much they have improved after using this retinol consistently! Fine lines around my eyes are also looking a lot better. And such a good price point!

Excellent retinol for nighttime, and also VERY affordable! I interchange this with my sample $80+ retinol serums, and they both make my skin feel and look the same way. This is my new go-to night retinol.
I luv this serum. This actually worked on my skin .. my skin is very sensitive .. this retinol serum help me in reducing my acne as well as acne scars .. very effective and less expensive!!!

I dreaded it every night.

I like the formula minus the silicone addition. I will not repurchase as I feel other products I apply following this will be challenging to penetrate. The new reformulated 0.5% by the ordinary will be my replacement.
